{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Associate",
  "description": "Care on Course is a platform designed to facilitate easy access to high-quality healthcare, all from the comfort of your home.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Responsibilities


	?Visit hospitals and pharmacies in person to introduce and pitch the Care on Course app.
	Guide facilities through the onboarding process (e.g. installation, profile setup, walkthrough).
	Distribute and explain flyers and demo the app.
	Respond to common questions and handle initial objections with confidence.
	Collect feedback and report it back weekly.
	Track all outreach, visits, onboardings, and outcomes in the shared tracker.


Required Skills &amp; Traits


	Excellent communication (spoken and written) in English and local dialect.
	?Prior experience in sales, business development, or field marketing.
	?Basic tech literacy &mdash; can use mobile apps, Google Forms, and WhatsApp professionally.
	Confident and respectful when speaking with hospital/pharmacy staff.
	Self-motivated and results-oriented &mdash; able to work with minimal supervision.


Salary
N100,000 - N250,000 monthly (depending on experience).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;CV to:&nbsp;info@careoncourse.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-05",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-22",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Care on Course"
    
  },

}



Business Development Associate Job at Care on Course




        
    

        
        Care on Course is a platform designed to facilitate easy access to high-quality healthcare, all from the comfort of your home.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Associate

Job Location: Lagos

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	?Visit hospitals and pharmacies in person to introduce and pitch the Care on Course app.
	Guide facilities through the onboarding process (e.g. installation, profile setup, walkthrough).
	Distribute and explain flyers and demo the app.
	Respond to common questions and handle initial objections with confidence.
	Collect feedback and report it back weekly.
	Track all outreach, visits, onboardings, and outcomes in the shared tracker.


Required Skills & Traits


	Excellent communication (spoken and written) in English and local dialect.
	?Prior experience in sales, business development, or field marketing.
	?Basic tech literacy — can use mobile apps, Google Forms, and WhatsApp professionally.
	Confident and respectful when speaking with hospital/pharmacy staff.
	Self-motivated and results-oriented — able to work with minimal supervision.


Salary
N100,000 - N250,000 monthly (depending on experience).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: info@careoncourse.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations Specialist",
  "description": "Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Specialist
Job Location:&nbsp;Ekiti

Job Description
We are seeking talented professionals who are passionate about socio-economic development through agricultural and Agro-allied investments.


	Plan and execute daily farm operations
	Monitor and track performance
	Coordinate resources
	Manage farm inputs
	Organize logistics
	Maintain inventory records
	Analyze operational data


Qualifications


	Diploma or Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Agriculture, Operations Management, Business Administration, or a related field, a minimum of 3 years of experience in farm operations, logistics, or a related field.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;talent@agbeyewa.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Operations Specialist Job at Agbeyewa Farms




        
    

        
        Agbeyewa Farms is a world-class agribusiness with farm operations in Ekiti State, Nigeria. We have foresight for expansion into Africa whilst we create decent jobs and economic opportunities for local communities and become a force to reckon with in the agribusiness on a global scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Specialist
Job Location: Ekiti

Job Description
We are seeking talented professionals who are passionate about socio-economic development through agricultural and Agro-allied investments.
     

            
    




	Plan and execute daily farm operations
	Monitor and track performance
	Coordinate resources
	Manage farm inputs
	Organize logistics
	Maintain inventory records
	Analyze operational data


Qualifications


	Diploma or Bachelor's Degree in Agriculture, Operations Management, Business Administration, or a related field, a minimum of 3 years of experience in farm operations, logistics, or a related field.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: talent@agbeyewa.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Assistant Manager - Client Service Delivery",
  "description": "At Willis Towers Watson Plc branded as WTW, we provide data-driven, insight-led solutions in the areas of people, risk and capital. Leveraging the global view and local expertise of our colleagues serving 140 countries and markets, we help you sharpen your strategy, enhance organizational resilience, motivate your workforce and maximize performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Manager - Client Service Delivery

Job Identification: 202505034
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos, Nigeria
Job Schedule: Full time
Job Category: Client Service and Delivery

Role


	The Assistant Manager, Client Service Delivery provides critical support to the Unit Manager in delivering high-caliber insurance services.
	This position encompasses underwriting, client account management, claims administration, and business development activities.
	The Assistant Manager is responsible for ensuring efficient documentation, effective communication, and seamless coordination with clients, insurers, and internal stakeholders.


Responsibilities


	Underwriting &amp; Client Interaction:&nbsp;Record and distribute meeting minutes, prepare slips and endorsements, negotiate terms with insurers, analyze quotations, and oversee the dispatch of policy documents and declarations.
	Client Debiting &amp; Payments:&nbsp;Generate debit notes and cover letters, ensure precise billing procedures, and accurately monitor client payments with appropriate documentation.
	Renewals Management:&nbsp;Track impending renewals, issue timely notifications and reminders, participate in renewal meetings, and coordinate placement processes with underwriters.
	Post-Renewal &amp; Claims:&nbsp;Maintain comprehensive post-renewal registers, administer the claims process from initial notification through settlement, and ensure all documentation and correspondence with clients and insurers are complete and accurate.
	Account Reconciliation:&nbsp;Prepare and verify statements of account for clients and insurers, reconcile debit and credit notes, and coordinate the issuance of credit notes as required.
	Reporting &amp; Documentation:&nbsp;Regularly update monthly production schedules, draft general correspondence, and maintain meticulous records in accordance with established internal procedures.
	Business Development:&nbsp;Identify and pursue prospective clients, assist the Unit Manager with client acquisition initiatives, and maintain accurate CRM records.
	Other Duties:&nbsp;Undertake additional tasks and responsibilities as assigned by the Head of Operations.


Requirements


	Minimum of 6 years of experience in a similar capacity.
	Demonstrable experience within a broking firm or insurance company is essential.
	Exceptional organizational and documentation skills.
	Experience in business development and client relationship management.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal capabilities.
	Proficiency in underwriting and claims management processes.
	Ability to oversee client accounts and manage related financial documentation.
	Familiarity with CRM systems and office productivity tools.
	Strong attention to detail and effective follow-up skills.
	Collaborative mindset with the ability to work under supervision.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-05",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Willis Towers Watson"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "185348"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Assistant Manager - Client Service Delivery Job at Willis Towers Watson Plc




        
    

        
        At Willis Towers Watson Plc branded as WTW, we provide data-driven, insight-led solutions in the areas of people, risk and capital. Leveraging the global view and local expertise of our colleagues serving 140 countries and markets, we help you sharpen your strategy, enhance organizational resilience, motivate your workforce and maximize performance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Manager - Client Service Delivery

Job Identification: 202505034
Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job Schedule: Full time
Job Category: Client Service and Delivery

Role
     

            
    




	The Assistant Manager, Client Service Delivery provides critical support to the Unit Manager in delivering high-caliber insurance services.
	This position encompasses underwriting, client account management, claims administration, and business development activities.
	The Assistant Manager is responsible for ensuring efficient documentation, effective communication, and seamless coordination with clients, insurers, and internal stakeholders.


Responsibilities


	Underwriting & Client Interaction: Record and distribute meeting minutes, prepare slips and endorsements, negotiate terms with insurers, analyze quotations, and oversee the dispatch of policy documents and declarations.
	Client Debiting & Payments: Generate debit notes and cover letters, ensure precise billing procedures, and accurately monitor client payments with appropriate documentation.
	Renewals Management: Track impending renewals, issue timely notifications and reminders, participate in renewal meetings, and coordinate placement processes with underwriters.
	Post-Renewal & Claims: Maintain comprehensive post-renewal registers, administer the claims process from initial notification through settlement, and ensure all documentation and correspondence with clients and insurers are complete and accurate.
	Account Reconciliation: Prepare and verify statements of account for clients and insurers, reconcile debit and credit notes, and coordinate the issuance of credit notes as required.
	Reporting & Documentation: Regularly update monthly production schedules, draft general correspondence, and maintain meticulous records in accordance with established internal procedures.
	Business Development: Identify and pursue prospective clients, assist the Unit Manager with client acquisition initiatives, and maintain accurate CRM records.
	Other Duties: Undertake additional tasks and responsibilities as assigned by the Head of Operations.


Requirements


	Minimum of 6 years of experience in a similar capacity.
	Demonstrable experience within a broking firm or insurance company is essential.
	Exceptional organizational and documentation skills.
	Experience in business development and client relationship management.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal capabilities.
	Proficiency in underwriting and claims management processes.
	Ability to oversee client accounts and manage related financial documentation.
	Familiarity with CRM systems and office productivity tools.
	Strong attention to detail and effective follow-up skills.
	Collaborative mindset with the ability to work under supervision.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Offshore Pipeline Specialist",
  "description": "Project Masters Nigeria Limited is a seasoned and fast-growing EPCI company providing services to the upstream sector of the oil and gas industry.&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Offshore Pipeline Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Rivers

Job Summary


	An Offshore Pipeline Specialist is responsible for the planning, design, installation, and maintenance of offshore pipeline systems used for transporting oil, gas, or other fluids.
	This role involves providing technical expertise on pipeline materials, construction methods, and operational integrity to ensure safe and efficient pipeline operations.


Qualifications / Certifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in: Subsea Engineering, Pipeline Engineering, Marine Engineering and Civil/Structural Engineering.
	5+ years of experience in offshore pipeline engineering or installation
	Should have a good knowledge of Pipeline design (on-bottom stability, free span, wall thickness, etc.) and Offshore installation support (S-lay, J-lay, Reel- lay methods)
	Should have BOSIET Basic Offshore Safety Induction and Emergency Training certification Strong problem-solving, analytical, and reporting skills


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to:&nbsp;info@projectmastersng.com&nbsp;and copy&nbsp;stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmb.gov.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

}



Offshore Pipeline Specialist Job at Project Masters Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Project Masters Nigeria Limited is a seasoned and fast-growing EPCI company providing services to the upstream sector of the oil and gas industry. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Offshore Pipeline Specialist

Job Location: Rivers

Job Summary
     

            
    




	An Offshore Pipeline Specialist is responsible for the planning, design, installation, and maintenance of offshore pipeline systems used for transporting oil, gas, or other fluids.
	This role involves providing technical expertise on pipeline materials, construction methods, and operational integrity to ensure safe and efficient pipeline operations.


Qualifications / Certifications


	Bachelor's Degree in: Subsea Engineering, Pipeline Engineering, Marine Engineering and Civil/Structural Engineering.
	5+ years of experience in offshore pipeline engineering or installation
	Should have a good knowledge of Pipeline design (on-bottom stability, free span, wall thickness, etc.) and Offshore installation support (S-lay, J-lay, Reel- lay methods)
	Should have BOSIET Basic Offshore Safety Induction and Emergency Training certification Strong problem-solving, analytical, and reporting skills


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: info@projectmastersng.com and copy stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmb.gov.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Project Masters Nigeria Limited is a seasoned and fast-growing EPCI company providing services to the upstream sector of the oil and gas industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Technical Operations Manager

Job Location: Rivers

Job Summary


	The Technical Operations Manager is responsible for overseeing the day-to-day technical functions of an organization to ensure efficient and effective operations.
	This role manages teams involved in system maintenance, infrastructure support, technical service delivery, and process optimization.


Qualifications / Certifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in a relevant field, such as: Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial, etc.) or Business Administration and other relevant academic credentials 8 years of experience in technical operations, engineering, or systems support, including supervisory roles
	Must possess Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) certification and Certified Operations Manager (COM)
	Familiarity with compliance, safety, and risk management


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;info@projectmastersng.com&nbsp;and copy&nbsp;stakeholder.recruitment@ncdmb.gov.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
